channel.title: BUbreakingHeadlines
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingHeadlines, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Scientists sue NIH, HHS, RFK Jr. over termination of research grants
item.description: Researchers who had millions of dollars' worth of grants terminated by the National Institutes of Health are suing the federal government.

item.title: Dow plunges more than 1,600 points as stocks recoil from tariff shock
item.description: Nasdaq also sinks more than 1,000 points as investors fret over the potential economic impact of President Trump's latest tariffs.

item.title: U.S. tourist lands on forbidden island to give Diet Coke to remote tribe
item.description: A U.S. tourist sneaked onto a highly restricted island carrying a coconut and a can of Diet Coke to a tribe untouched by the modern world, police said...

item.title: South Korean court removes impeached president over martial law declaration
item.description: Impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol was removed from office four months after he declared martial law, sending troops into parliament.

item.title: Trump admin live updates: National Security Agency chief and deputy director fired
item.description: "For $5 million, this can be yours," he said, adding that he was the "first buyer."

item.title: Trump tariffs live updates: China to impose 34% tariff on all US goods
item.description: Fallout continues after President Donald Trump's unveiling of severe tariffs against virtually all U.S. trading partners.

item.title: Republicans moving ahead with Trump's 'big' bill of tax breaks and spending cuts
item.description: After a long wait, the Senate is launching action on President Donald Trump’s ”“big, beautiful bill” of tax breaks and spending cuts
